content:
I have a double integral on a symmetric domain (s : Set ℝ)
∫ (x : ℝ) (y : ℝ) in s, f(x,y)
(assuming the integral exists, etc) how do transform this into
1/2 * ∫ (x : ℝ) (x y : ℝ) in s, f(x,y)+f(y,x)
in Lean?
I'm guessing split the integral up in two and change the order of integration and then recombine.
Had a look at the undergrad page, nothing jumped out at me.
never mind that's not going to work
Nicholas Wilson has marked this topic as resolved.
